  1. Oxford 3000
  2. Oxford 06

Words 501-600

  1. comfort
    She found comfort in talking to her best friend.

  2. comfortable
    This chair is very comfortable to sit on.

  3. command
    The officer gave a clear command to the soldiers.

  4. comment
    He left a comment on the article to share his opinion.

  5. commercial
    The commercial on TV was about a new car.

  6. commission
    She earned a commission for selling the house.

  7. commit
    He decided to commit to finishing the project on time.

  8. commitment
    Marriage is a big commitment between two people.

  9. committee
    The committee will meet tomorrow to discuss the plan.

  10. common
    It is common to see birds in the park during the morning.

  11. commonly
    This word is commonly used in everyday conversations.

  12. communicate
    They use email to communicate with their clients.

  13. communication
    Good communication is important in any relationship.

  14. community
    The community came together to clean the park.

  15. company
    She works for a company that makes software.

  16. compare
    You should compare the prices before buying anything.

  17. comparison
    In comparison to last year, sales have increased.

  18. compete
    Many athletes compete in the Olympic Games.

  19. competition
    The competition was tough, but she won the race.

  20. competitive
    He has a very competitive nature and always wants to win.

  21. competitor
    Their main competitor launched a new product last week.

  22. complain
    Customers often complain about slow service.

  23. complaint
    She filed a complaint about the noise from her neighbors.

  24. complete
    Please complete the form and return it to the office.

  25. completely
    The room was completely silent during the speech.

  26. complex
    The problem is more complex than it seems.

  27. complicated
    The instructions were so complicated that no one understood them.

  28. component
    The engine is a key component of the car.

  29. computer
    He uses his computer to write reports and send emails.

  30. concentrate
    She needs to concentrate on her studies to pass the exam.

  31. concentration
    His concentration was broken by the loud noise outside.

  32. concept
    The concept of freedom is important in many cultures.

  33. concern
    There is growing concern about climate change.

  34. concerned
    She is concerned about her son’s health.

  35. concert
    They went to a concert to see their favorite band perform.

  36. conclude
    The meeting will conclude with a summary of the decisions.

  37. conclusion
    In conclusion, we need to work harder to achieve our goals.

  38. condition
    The car is in excellent condition despite being old.

  39. conduct
    The scientist will conduct an experiment in the lab.

  40. conference
    The annual conference will be held in New York this year.

  41. confidence
    She spoke with confidence during her presentation.

  42. confident
    He feels confident about passing the exam.

  43. confirm
    Please confirm your attendance by replying to this email.

  44. conflict
    The conflict between the two countries lasted for years.

  45. confuse
    The instructions might confuse people who are new to the task.

  46. confused
    I was confused by the directions and got lost.

  47. confusing
    The map was so confusing that no one could follow it.

  48. connect
    You can connect your phone to the Wi-Fi network.

  49. connected
    The two cities are connected by a high-speed train.

  50. connection
    There is a strong connection between exercise and good health.

  51. conscious
    She was conscious of the fact that everyone was watching her.

  52. consequence
    Every decision has a consequence, whether good or bad.

  53. conservative
    He has a conservative approach to spending money.

  54. consider
    Please consider my suggestion before making a decision.

  55. consideration
    After careful consideration, she decided to take the job.

  56. consist
    The team will consist of five members.

  57. consistent
    Her work is always of consistent quality.

  58. constant
    The constant noise from the construction site was annoying.

  59. constantly
    He constantly checks his phone for new messages.

  60. construct
    They plan to construct a new bridge over the river.

  61. construction
    The construction of the new building will take two years.

  62. consume
    People consume a lot of energy during the summer.

  63. consumer
    The company focuses on providing value to the consumer.

  64. contact
    You can contact me by phone or email if you have questions.

  65. contain
    This box can contain up to 10 kilograms of items.

  66. container
    She used a plastic container to store the leftovers.

  67. contemporary
    The museum has a collection of contemporary art.

  68. content1
    The book’s content1 is easy to understand for beginners.

  69. contest
    She won first prize in the singing contest.

  70. context
    The meaning of the word depends on the context in which it is used.

  71. continent
    Africa is the second-largest continent in the world.

  72. continue
    They will continue the meeting after lunch.

  73. continuous
    The continuous rain caused flooding in the area.

  74. contract
    He signed a contract to work for the company for two years.

  75. contrast
    There is a big contrast between city life and country life.

  76. contribute
    Everyone is encouraged to contribute to the discussion.

  77. contribution
    Her contribution to the project was highly appreciated.

  78. control
    He tried to control his anger during the argument.

  79. convenient
    The store is in a convenient location near my house.

  80. conversation
    They had a long conversation about their future plans.

  81. convert
    You can convert the file into a different format.

  82. convince
    She tried to convince him to join the team.

  83. convinced
    I am convinced that this is the right decision.

  84. cook
    She loves to cook meals for her family.

  85. cooker
    The rice cooker makes cooking much easier.

  86. cooking
    Cooking is one of her favorite hobbies.

  87. cool
    The weather is cool and perfect for a walk.

  88. copy
    Please make a copy of this document for your records.

  89. core
    The core of the problem lies in poor communication.

  90. corner
    There is a small shop at the corner of the street.

  91. corporate
    He works in the corporate office of a large company.

  92. correct
    Please correct the errors in this report.

  93. correctly
    She answered all the questions correctly on the test.

  94. cost
    The cost of living in the city is very high.

  95. costume
    She wore a beautiful costume for the party.

  96. cottage
    They stayed in a small cottage by the lake.

  97. cotton
    This shirt is made of 100% cotton.

  98. could
    Could you help me with this heavy box?

  99. council
    The city council approved the new park project.

  100. count
    Can you count how many apples are in the basket?
